The roots of Mascotte trace back to around 1885, when founder J.W.  Payne first settled the area. The city takes its name from the  Mascotte, a ship owned by Tampa civic leader Henry B. Plant. The  vessel, which played a role in transporting tobacco from Cuba during  the Spanish-American War, is proudly on the city's official seal.
